intro: Thlaspi antitauricum, commonly known as the Tauric cabbageworm, is a species of flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous areas. It is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates and is adapted to withstand dry conditions. Thlaspi antitauricum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain insect species.
